I've used Grizz' Preying Mantis and have literally chopped up everything in sight.  I modified it to Monk 11/Ranger 10 for poison immunity.

The RNG21/M12/WM7 gives you "light" SR of 22, immunity to poison, +2 dmg vs. FE plus BOE at the cost of 3AB and an epic feat.

6 of one, half a dozen of the other . . .

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: There is a reason GDL did not make that build a "Ranger 23/ Monk 10/ WM 7" as you would not only lose 3 AB but also 3 epic feats that come from the WM itself. Then you would have to use your "Great Strength" feats to take them (EWF, AS, EP) and lose another point of AB at least, from the reduced strength of your build. All that to gain BoE but for only 5 FE's, which is really a gamble more than anything else. Stay with the Original, damage is plenty already with the cheat-kamas-ten-attacks-of-doom ;-)

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: Actually, what you NEED are Monk 6 for IKD, Ranger 9 for dual-wielding and Wm 16 for AB and feats. I might also suggest an alternative spread that is not better or worse than the Preying Mantis: ranger 15 / Monk 9 / WM 16. You lose 1 AC From Monk 10, 1 AB from WM 19, but you don't lose the feat because if you take Ranger 15 in EPICS you'll be able to take Epic Prowess with it. What you gain is Level 4 Ranger spells (Mass Camouflage, anyone?), more skill points and skill dumps for trap skills. It's worth a mention, which incidentally was done by Jenalee in the last post that I just read after typing all this shit lol
